trans-unit.source: Use Azure Stream Analytics with SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Azure Stream Analytics with SQL Data Warehouse | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Tips for using Azure Stream Analytics with Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.
trans-unit.target: Tips for using Azure Stream Analytics with Azure SQL Data Warehouse for developing solutions.

trans-unit.source: Azure Stream Analytics is a fully managed service providing low-latency, highly available, scalable complex event processing over streaming data in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Azure Stream Analytics is a fully managed service providing low-latency, highly available, scalable complex event processing over streaming data in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: You can learn the basics by reading <linkText>Introduction to Azure Stream Analytics</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can learn the basics by reading <linkText>Introduction to Azure Stream Analytics</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can then learn how to create an end-to-end solution with Stream Analytics using <linkText>Get Started tutorial</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can then learn how to create an end-to-end solution with Stream Analytics using <linkText>Get Started tutorial</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In this article, you will learn how to use your Azure SQL Data Warehouse database as an output sink for your Steam Analytics jobs.
trans-unit.target: In this article, you will learn how to use your Azure SQL Data Warehouse database as an output sink for your Steam Analytics jobs.

trans-unit.source: First, run through the following steps in <linkText>Get Started tutorial</linkText><title></title> tutorial.
trans-unit.target: First, run through the following steps in <linkText>Get Started tutorial</linkText><title></title> tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Create an Event Hub input
trans-unit.target: Create an Event Hub input

trans-unit.source: Configure and start event generator application
trans-unit.target: Configure and start event generator application

trans-unit.source: Provision a Stream Analytics job
trans-unit.target: Provision a Stream Analytics job

trans-unit.source: Specify job input and query
trans-unit.target: Specify job input and query

trans-unit.source: Then, create an Azure SQL Data Warehouse database
trans-unit.target: Then, create an Azure SQL Data Warehouse database

trans-unit.source: In your Stream Analytics job click OUTPUT from the top of the page, and then click ADD OUTPUT.
trans-unit.target: In your Stream Analytics job click OUTPUT from the top of the page, and then click ADD OUTPUT.

trans-unit.source: Select SQL Database and click next.
trans-unit.target: Select SQL Database and click next.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following values on the next page
trans-unit.target: Enter the following values on the next page

trans-unit.source: Output Alias: Enter a friendly name for this job output.
trans-unit.target: Output Alias: Enter a friendly name for this job output.

trans-unit.source: Subscription:
trans-unit.target: Subscription:

trans-unit.source: If your SQL Data Warehouse database is in the same subscription as the Stream Analytics job, select Use SQL Database from Current Subscription.
trans-unit.target: If your SQL Data Warehouse database is in the same subscription as the Stream Analytics job, select Use SQL Database from Current Subscription.

trans-unit.source: If your database is in a different subscription, select Use SQL Database from Another Subscription.
trans-unit.target: If your database is in a different subscription, select Use SQL Database from Another Subscription.

trans-unit.source: Database: Specify the name of a destination database.
trans-unit.target: Database: Specify the name of a destination database.

trans-unit.source: Server Name: Specify the server name for the database you just specified.
trans-unit.target: Server Name: Specify the server name for the database you just specified.

trans-unit.source: You can use the Azure Portal to find this.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Azure Portal to find this.

trans-unit.source: User Name: Specify the user name of an account that has write permissions for the database.
trans-unit.target: User Name: Specify the user name of an account that has write permissions for the database.

trans-unit.source: Password: Provide the password for the specified user account.
trans-unit.target: Password: Provide the password for the specified user account.

trans-unit.source: Table: Specify the name of the target table in the database.
trans-unit.target: Table: Specify the name of the target table in the database.

trans-unit.source: Click the check button to add this job output and to verify that Stream Analytics can successfully connect to the database.
trans-unit.target: Click the check button to add this job output and to verify that Stream Analytics can successfully connect to the database.

trans-unit.source: When the connection to the database succeeds, you will see a notification at the bottom of the portal.
trans-unit.target: When the connection to the database succeeds, you will see a notification at the bottom of the portal.

trans-unit.source: You can click Test Connection at the bottom to test the connection to the database.
trans-unit.target: You can click Test Connection at the bottom to test the connection to the database.

trans-unit.source: For an overview of integration, see <linkText>SQL Data Warehouse integration overview</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For an overview of integration, see <linkText>SQL Data Warehouse integration overview</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: For more development tips, see <linkText>SQL Data Warehouse development overview</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more development tips, see <linkText>SQL Data Warehouse development overview</linkText><title></title>.
